subject: Pedal Compatibility
description_text:
Hi, Support.

I'm looking to buy the Plus X 3-pedal set and wondering if I require the pedal plate to fit the Sim-Lab GT 1 Pro cockpit?

Thanks!
Caedryn.

conversations.body_text: Hi Caedryn FitzGerald, I have reviewed the manual for this bracket. Since the pedal mounting part of the bracket uses an aluminum profile design, our pedals are compatible with it. Also, could you let me know the price of this bracket?

Thanks for such a quick response!

The Sim-Lab baseplate on its own is â‚¬89. I was referring to the Simsonn baseplate being compatible with the Sim-Lab rig itself. This is my first SIM rig so I'm a little confused regarding which baseplate I need, Simsonn's or Sim-Lab's?

Sent from Outlook for Android<https://aka.ms/AAb9ysg>
Hi Caedryn FitzGerald, Please send me the purchase links for the SimLab bracket and base so I can help you verify them.

Here is the pedal plate link:
https://sim-lab.eu/products/pedal-slider-baseplate-sim-racing?variant=44008850719014

Here is the link to the roof itself:

Hi Caedryn FitzGerald, If you purchase a Sim-Lab pedal base, it is fully compatible with our pedals, and there is no need to purchase our pedal base separately.

Thanks so much for looking into that for me. I've actually decided to go with Trak Racer TR160 V5 as I saw a review of your pedals on that rig.

They have two pedal plate options. I'm hoping both will be compatible with the Plus X?

https://trakracer.eu/products/tr-one-adjustable-gen2-pedal-mounting-system-including-mounting-profile-and-heel-rest?variant=41549380452546

https://trakracer.eu/products/tr-one-adjustable-gen2-pedal-mounting-system-including-pre-drilled-pedal-plate?variant=41549370884290

Apologies for all the questions.
Hi Caedryn FitzGerald, I have checked the mounting spacing in the two links you provided, and the base plate can support our PlusX pedals.
